alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 3:21AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Henderson, Hancock and Des Moines Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Henderson, Louisa, Mercer and Des Moines Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Burlington. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings and homes in Montrose and Niota. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning and continue rising to 16.5 feet Monday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
